wikipedia_page.main: Emma Jane Greenland (later, Emma Jane Greenland Hooker; 1760–1838) was an English painter, writer and singer. She was awarded a Gold Pallet on 14 November  1786 by the Society at London for the Encouragement of Arts, Manufactures, and Commerce. Greenland may have been a pupil of Johann Christian Bach, and she owned some of his manuscripts after his death.
